Reviews.Title: “New Years Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: AnitaBen
Reviews.Content: I searched high and low to find accommodation for over the New Year Period. We were travelling for the "Sydney Resolution NYE Concert". This was a delightful surprise! We didn't need too much for this 3 day trip, cause it was already costing us a fortune. The location was fine for our needs and we enjoyed the long walks as opposed to the expensive taxi option. The room was modern, clean and tidy (my only preference would be for a bigger, more lit up bathroom!) and there are plenty of trendy shops and cafes to visit along Crown Street. They provided a common area where you could help yourself to coffee and breakfast in your own time and everyday our room was cleaned. You would think being inside the same building as a pub and restaurant, opposite a busy intersection you would struggle to hear yourself think, but surprisingly we had no problems in the time we were there (from Friday to Sunday- their busiest times). It wasn't the fanciest hotel we have stayed at, but certainly met our needs and for this whirlwind trip. If I wanted to save money by staying away from the shops in the city and relax more, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Pub Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: TripTaker2407
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days in October 2011. First surprise was when the cab pulled up at a pub. We weren't sure if we were at the right place as there was not one sign indicating that accommodation was available. We made ourselves known at the bar and the manager then showed us upstairs to the accommodation, which is several levels above the pub. To be fair, we didn't hear any noise from the pub below, but what did wake us up every morning was the communal breakfast table being outside our door. Everyone eats together - cereal, pastries, toast - like in a hostel. The table and chairs are plastic and the latter can be audibly heard scraping against the floor. A floor mat certainly wouldn't go astray. The room itself is nice enough, but I noticed our sheets were stained and had holes, albeit small. The shower is great, but there is only a tiny basin below the cabinet (watch your head when brushing your teeth) and not an inch of bench space. All in all, a very mediocre visit. Worthy of 2.5-3 stars, but certainly not 4.

Reviews.Title: “surprising and good”
Reviews.Author: BusinessExpert
Reviews.Content: I am a regular traveler for work and have stayed in hundreds of hotels. First surprise was when the cab pulled up and it was a pub. I dragged my bags in and ask is the Crown Hotel with accommodation? The positive bar staff got the manager who took me up stairs. The halls are dark and then suddenly lit up by sensor lights... seemed a bit odd. Got to the room it was clean and tidy with reasonably appointed furniture etc. The light and fittings including one chair are all plastic and sort of has that this is also a brothel! THe maanger mentioned the pub ran 24hours a day and being on a busy intersection I was concerned about the noise and was surprised just how quite it was- it was a thusday night which may have helped. The are has a wide range of restaurants etc, half I am surprised have a licence to run the others are very classy (odd mix all in one street). There is also Coles supermarket across the road. All in all OK - just the price of $160 for the night means I would have been better off in the City

Reviews.Title: “good value in a convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: c3j7s
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant to book this hotel after reading the reviews, but couldn't resist the wotif price of $120 in Surry Hills! The room was a perfect size for the two of us, the decor was fantastic, and we love Surry Hills! If you are a bit of a snob when it comes to hotels, I wouldn't reccommend it as there's no silver service here. It's very casual, and that's actually what we liked about it. Our room was facing Crown Street, so the noise of the traffic wasn't the most pleasant and the blinds don't do much to keep the sun out.. so if you're jetlagged and desperate for an un-disturbed sleep, bring some earplugs and an eyemask! We liked that we could grab a drink from the downstairs bar and take it up to our room, as all the bottle shops in the area had closed. If you want a trendy, casual, spacious and modern room in Surry Hills, you can't complain too much about Crown...especially for $120, bargain!! We'll be back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Let down by poor housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: oakbelle
Reviews.Content: Very noisy â€“ take your ear plugs as it is on a cross road. Smart white timber venetians donâ€™t keep out the street lighting at all â€“ take your travel mask too. Very smartly fitted out but let down by poor housekeeping. Unironed and very crinkled pillowcases, home washed towels still bearing makeup marks. 3 bathmats but only one small towel and no face washer. No coffee cups, teaspoons or glasses provided. Spoke to the manager and he said that people steal them if they provide them. At $160 per night for one person, I do need a coffee cup and glass provided in the room. Lovely barman very obligingly provided all at 11pm plus ice bucket and ice. No coathangers or tissues. Fridge was totally iced over and all mini bar drinks were frozen solid, 5 bottles of juice were all out of date, one dated March 09 (on July 24, 2010). Fridge had spilt cream or milk in it from previous occupant. Next day, housekeeping did not remove or wash used glass or mug. The milk provided for coffee was off, and on checking, it was out of date (22 July on 24 July) and was left in room unrefrigerated when it was not longlife milk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice idea - let down by lack of attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: brisgooner
Reviews.Content: I didn't realise this was the pub when I booked - should have researched better - my fault. Still, on arrival at 830pm tried to check in and got the silent back turned treatment from someone who I assume was the shift manager in the pub. Checked in - perfectly good room. Bit noisy (its a pub on Crown St - so that's OK, goes with the territory). The shower flatters to deceive though looks like something out someone's palace, but you have to run around to get wet there is so little water coming out. Not exactly "bargain" either, you can get a room in a decent chain hotel for pretty much the same rate. Probably OK if you're young and groovy (I'm no longer either of those), but then if you're young and groovy you don't actually need to sleep (or shower?)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AdPal80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crown in March 2007 for a week long stay in Sydney. After the long flight from SFO I found the bathroom to be quite inviting with the large clean glass enclosed counter. After I de-grimed myself I was able to appreciate the size of the room and it's appointments. The bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. The daily breakfast was to my liking but I could see how travellers from the US might think it's skimpy. I enjoyed the coffee machine once I learned how to use it and didn't mind sharing the space with other travellers. The only drawback that I could think of was that there wasn't a hotel staff member there at all times but anyone at the pub below was at your service and were very friendly with us. I was a bit worried about staying above a pub but our room was extremely quiet at night and we had no trouble sleeping. The location is great. Crown street has wonderful restaurants and access to many of the bus lines in Sydney, which is one of the best public bus systems I have ever used. For the price I think you get more than your money's worth, I would recommend this hotel for other travelers and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “High style at a loud decibel”
Reviews.Author: dallhiss
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend this property to an avid party-er who plans to go out late every night. The Surrey Hills neighborhood is a great place to stay with its laid-back vibe and trendy restaurants and boutiques. The Crown fits right in with a high style quotient and truly boutique experience (less than 10 units). The rooms are well-appointed and you have access to a wine shop, gaming and a nightclub lounge. Therein lies the challenge with the property. The accommodations are located directly above the Dome nightclub which is open nightly from 9pm to 2am. With a deficient amount of sound-proofing, every beat vibrates in the room and you can also hear all of the lyrics ('Billie Jean,' anyone?) During the Dome's hours of operation, there is no way to sleep, much less do anything else except join the loungers downstairs until last call.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain 4 star hotel above a pub”
Reviews.Author: dasberliner
Reviews.Content: Ok, so you want to stay in Surry Hills and be close to all the action of Crown and Oxford Streets, well here is the place. The old Crown hotel was renovated a few years back and above the pub they turned the place into a mini 4 star hotel with about 8 rooms, with two opening onto a courtyard, with a breakfast room in the middle. Strange? Yes but it works. The place is hip, they have L'Octaine soaps and shampoos, 42 inch plasma tv's and a decent continental breaky!

HotelInfo.Name: Crown Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 589 Crown Street | Surrey Hills, Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia
